Michael Stack wrote:
> Yousef Ourabi wrote:
>>
>> It seems like there isn't a branch for the 1.8 release -- or am I 
>> missing something? The highest branch is heritrix-1_6, and the highest 
>> version is heritrix-1_7_2 (which I assume is a dev release).
> 
> Hey Yousef:
> 
> You are right.  There is no branch for 1.8 release (and heritrix-1_7_2 
> is an internal dev release).  Sourceforge CVS was in a state of flux 
> around time of the  1.8.0 release and the branch seems to have been lost.  
> 
> At this stage, doing a CVS timestamp checkout is best way to get 1.8 
> source.  To find the date-to-use, look at the cvs log of project.xml.  
> See when the version number was moved to 1.8.
> 
> Otherwise, get source bundle from sourceforge.

May 9 2006 would be a good date to get.

A handful of commits on May 8 touched up version numbers, dates, and one 
release-notes ampersand-escaping issue, labelled the release, and then 
the official 1.8 release was built.  (It can still be found on the build 
box, at...

http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/HEAD-heritrix?log=log20060508032349Lbuild.937

...which matches the 1.8.0 bundles in the Sourceforge 'files' download 
area.)

But, soon afterward, Sourceforge CVS 'lost' those May 8 commits. So the 
1.8 release files available as file bundles from Sourceforge 'files' are 
in a sense from a 'CVS alternate history' no longer visible in 
Sourceforge 'CVS'.

If it becomes necessary to do a 1.8.1 release, we'd reconstruct a 
'heritrix-1_8_0' label. So far, though, we've been content to leave this 
as an anomaly.

- Gordon @ IA
